description: From worry +â€Ž wart, apparently chosen for alliteration. Presumably related to earlier worryguts. Attested 1956, but earlier examples are found in newspapers of the 1930s and 1940s.

entries.meaning: (originally US) A person who worries excessively, especially about unimportant matters.
examples: Synonyms: bundle of nerves, worrier; see also Thesaurus:worrier
